marketNews.title: SKK Migas Head Dwi Soetjipto Says Indonesia Targets Additional Liquefied Petroleum Gas Output To Reduce Imports
marketNews.content: Head of SKK Migas, Dwi Soetjipto, stated that his office is targeting an additional liquefied petroleum gas (LPG) production of around 1 million tons per year in the next 3-4 years to reduce imports. Dwi mentioned that SKK Migas has identified 15 gas fields that have the potential to supply gas for this additional production. Currently, Indonesia only produces 1.7 million tons of LPG per year. In 2023, Indonesia imported 6.9 million tons of LPG out of the 8.7 million tons sold in the domestic market.

marketNews.title: US Labor Statistics Bureau Notes US Job Openings Fell to Lowest Level Since January 2021
marketNews.content: The US labor statistics bureau recorded that the number of job openings in the US fell by 418,000 to 7.44 million in September 2024 from 7.86 million in August 2024, below consensus expectations which predicted 7.99 million and marking the lowest level since January 2021.

tickerNews.title: ASII Q3 2024: Solid Net Profit Growth, Exceeding Expectations
tickerNews.content: Astra International (ASII) posted a strong net profit in 3Q24 of IDR 10 trillion (+21% YoY, +19% QoQ). This result brought the net profit for 9M24 to IDR 25.9 trillion (+1% YoY), exceeding expectations as it reached 84% of the consensus FY24F estimate. Although the net profit was helped by foreign exchange gains and other income totaling IDR 1.7 trillion (vs. 3Q23: profit IDR 769 billion, 2Q24: profit IDR 208 billion), ASII still recorded solid operational performance. Operating profit in 3Q24 rose to IDR 10.9 trillion (+12% YoY, +2% QoQ), resulting in an operating profit for 9M24 of IDR 31.8 trillion (-2% YoY) and equivalent to 80% of the consensus FY24F estimate. This positive operational performance was mainly driven by: 1) the Mining, Construction, and Energy segment under its subsidiary United Tractors (UNTR); and 2) the Financial Services segment. UNTR recorded solid performance. Operating profit from the UNTR segment reached IDR 7.1 trillion (+29% YoY, +0% QoQ) in 3Q24, bringing the UNTR segment's operating profit for 9M24 to IDR 20.9 trillion (-2% YoY). UNTR's performance is considered solid, considering the lower coal prices this year on a YoY basis. Based on its sub-segments, mining contracting (Pamapersada), coal mining, and gold were the pillars of UNTR's performance amidst falling heavy equipment sales. Motor segment outperforms cars. Operating profit from the Financial Services segment grew to IDR 2.2 trillion (+5% YoY, +1% QoQ) in 3Q24, leading to a 10% YoY increase in Financial Services segment operating profit to IDR 6.6 trillion during 9M24. ASII Management mentioned that the growth in this segment occurred along with a +9% YoY increase in consumer financing, especially in motorcycle financing. The solid performance of the motor segment was also reflected in the net profit of PT Astra Honda Motor (AHM) which grew to IDR 3 trillion in 3Q24 (+17% YoY, +24% QoQ), driven entirely by the growth in motorcycle sales volume (+17% YoY, +25% QoQ). Thanks to AHM's strong net profit, ASII's share of profit from associated entities and JVs rose to IDR 2.7 trillion (+4% YoY, +15% QoQ). Meanwhile, the automotive segment recorded weak performance due to sluggish sales volume. Key Takeaway: With this performance exceeding expectations, we expect the consensus to increase ASII's net profit estimates for FY24F, especially for the UNTR segment. Given the lack of an increase in ASII performance estimates from the consensus in the last 3 months, we assess that this 3Q24 performance release will be responded to positively and significantly by the market in tomorrow's trading, Thursday (31/10).

tickerNews.title: BMRI 9M24: Net Profit +7.6% YoY; Loan Growth +20.8% YoY
tickerNews.content: Bank Mandiri (BMRI) recorded a net profit of IDR 15.5 trillion (+12% QoQ, +12% YoY) in 3Q24. This result brought the net profit for 9M24 to IDR 42 trillion (+7.6% YoY), exceeding expectations as it was equivalent to 76% of the consensus FY24F estimate. This realization was supported by the maintenance of credit cost (CoC) during 9M24 at 0.9% (vs. 1H24: 1%), which is better than management's FY24 guidance of 1-1.2%. Responding to the improved asset quality, BMRI management upgraded the FY24 CoC guidance from 1-1.2% to <=1%. Meanwhile, credit growth during 9M24 reached +20.8% YoY (vs. 2Q24: +20.5% YoY), exceeding management's FY24 guidance of +16-18%. On the other hand, the Net Interest Margin during 9M24 reached 5.1%, at the low end of management's FY24 guidance.

tickerNews.title: BBRI 9M24 Performance
tickerNews.content: Bank Rakyat Indonesia (BBRI) recorded a net profit of IDR 15.4 trillion (+11.2% QoQ, +5.4% YoY) in 3Q24. This result brought the net profit for 9M24 to IDR 45.1 trillion (+2.4% YoY), slightly below expectations as it was equivalent to 74.2% of the consensus FY24F estimate. This result was driven by the growth in Pre-Provision Operating Profit to IDR 90.5 trillion (+13.9% YoY) during 9M24, supported by a Net Interest Margin of 7.7% (vs. 9M23: 8.1%) and Non-Interest Income growth to IDR 54.5 trillion (+39.1% YoY) following the recovery of written-off assets. Meanwhile, credit cost (CoC) during 9M24 deteriorated to 3.39%, primarily driven by an increase in CoC from its subsidiary, PT Permodalan Nasional Madani, for front-loading provisions for the micro business segment. Credit growth slowed to +8.2% YoY in 3Q24 (vs. 2Q24: +11.2% YoY).

tickerNews.title: TLKM 9M24 Performance: Operating Profit Decline Due to Revenue Drop and Higher COGS
tickerNews.content: Telkom Indonesia (TLKM) recorded a net profit of IDR 5.9 trillion (-12% YoY, +4% QoQ) in 3Q24. This result brought the net profit for 9M24 to IDR 17.7 trillion (-9% YoY), below expectations as it was only equivalent to 71% of the consensus FY24 estimate. Operationally, operating profit fell to IDR 10.6 trillion (-15% YoY, +2% QoQ) due to a decline in revenue (-2% YoY, -2% QoQ) and an increase in cost of goods sold (+4% YoY, +3% QoQ). This result led to an operating profit for 9M24 of IDR 32.4 trillion (-7% YoY), below expectations as it was only equivalent to 72% of the consensus FY24 estimate. The average revenue per user (ARPU) for the mobile segment in 3Q24 fell to IDR 43.1 thousand (-11% YoY, -4% QoQ), with customer numbers falling to 158.4 million (+0.1% YoY, -1% QoQ).

tickerNews.title: PANI Q3 2024 Strong Net Profit Growth, Marketing Sales Target Upgraded
tickerNews.content: Pantai Indah Kapuk Dua (PANI) recorded a net profit of IDR 202 billion (+364% YoY, +24% QoQ) in 3Q24. This result brought the net profit for 9M24 to IDR 487 billion (+91% YoY), driven by revenue growth, gross profit margin expansion, and efficient opex. Revenue in 3Q24 from property project recognition grew +92% YoY, with the gross profit margin rising to 59.4% (+750 bps YoY, +550 bps QoQ). Combined with efficient opex (-4% YoY, +2% QoQ), this led to a strong operating profit growth in 3Q24 to IDR 360 billion (+215% YoY, +20% QoQ), resulting in an operating profit for 9M24 of IDR 934 billion (+45% YoY). PANI Management also upgraded the 2024 marketing sales target by about +9% to IDR 6 trillion, so the realization of marketing sales during 9M24, which reached IDR 4.67 trillion (+168% YoY), has met 78% of the new target.

tickerNews.title: ISAT Q3 2024 Net Profit +30% YoY, Operating Profit +13% YoY
tickerNews.content: Indosat (ISAT) recorded a net profit of IDR 1.1 trillion (+30% YoY, -21% QoQ) in 3Q24. This result brought the net profit for 9M24 to IDR 3.9 trillion (+39% YoY), in line with expectations as it was equivalent to 74% of the consensus FY24F estimate. At the operational level, the operating profit reached IDR 2.7 trillion (+13% YoY, -6% QoQ), resulting in an operating profit for 9M24 of IDR 8.4 trillion (+28% YoY) and in line with expectations as it was equivalent to 73% of the consensus FY24 estimate. The average revenue per user (ARPU) for the mobile segment in 3Q24 fell to IDR 37.2 thousand (+2% YoY, -3% QoQ), with customer numbers falling to 98.7 million (-1% YoY, -2% QoQ).

tickerNews.title: TAPG to Distribute 2024 Interim Dividend of IDR 1.51 Trillion
tickerNews.content: Triputra Agro Persada (TAPG) will distribute an interim dividend for the 2024 fiscal year amounting to IDR 1.51 trillion or IDR 76 per share. The cum dividend for the regular and negotiation markets is on November 7, 2024, with payment on November 20, 2024. Referring to TAPG's stock price on Wednesday (30/10) at IDR 915 per share, the indicative dividend yield is 8.3%.

tickerNews.title: Bukalapak (BUKA) Plans Restructuring Including Layoffs in the Next 2 Quarters
tickerNews.content: Bukalapak Director, Willix Halim, stated that his company plans to conduct restructuring, which will result in layoffs in the next 2 quarters. BUKA has decided to focus on its core businesses, namely Mitra Bukalapak, gaming, investment, and several retail services.

tickerNews.title: PTBA Q3 2024 Net Profit +19% YoY, 9M24 Net Profit -15% YoY Pulled Down by Lower Other Income
tickerNews.content: Bukit Asam (PTBA) recorded a net profit of IDR 1.2 trillion (+19% YoY, -4% QoQ) in 3Q24. This result brought the net profit for 9M24 to IDR 3.2 trillion (-15% YoY), equivalent to 66%/73% of Stockbit/consensus FY24F estimates. Operationally, the cost of goods sold (+15% YoY) increased higher than revenue growth (+11% YoY). This resulted in an operating profit for 9M24 falling to IDR 3.6 trillion (-8% YoY), equivalent to 61%/68% of Stockbit/consensus FY24F estimates. Furthermore, the net profit for 9M24 was also suppressed by a decrease in other income to IDR 610 billion (-47% YoY).

tickerNews.title: TSPC Q3 2024 Net Profit Weighed Down by FX Loss; Core Profit Shows Strong Growth
tickerNews.content: Tempo Scan Pacific (TSPC) recorded a net profit of IDR 262 billion in 3Q24 (+1% YoY, -37% QoQ), resulting in a net profit for 9M24 of IDR 1.1 trillion (+14% YoY). The weak 3Q24 net profit was pressured by a foreign exchange loss recorded in the other expenses line item of IDR 161 billion (vs. 3Q23: loss of IDR 3 billion, 2Q24: profit of IDR 64 billion). Excluding the foreign exchange loss, TSPC's core profit grew strongly to IDR 423 billion (+61% YoY, +21% QoQ) in 3Q24, marking an all-time high quarterly core profit level. This result led to a significant increase in core profit for 9M24 by +83% YoY to IDR 1.1 trillion, exceeding our expectations as it was equivalent to 81% of Stockbit's FY24F net profit estimate.

tickerNews.title: GGRM Q3 2024 Net Profit Slumps Significantly Due to Sales Decline and Margin Pressure
tickerNews.content: Gudang Garam (GGRM) recorded a net profit of IDR 67 billion (-94% YoY, -80% QoQ) in 3Q24. This result brought the net profit for 9M24 to IDR 992 billion (-78% YoY), far below expectations as only equivalent to 30% of the consensus FY24F expectation. The weak performance in 3Q24 was suppressed by a decline in sales (-7.8% YoY), which was most likely triggered by a decrease in cigarette sales volume. The gross profit margin also decreased by -400 bps YoY in 3Q23, likely caused by ASP increases that could not offset the excise tax increase. Operating expenses in 3Q24 rose +9% YoY, so operating profit in 3Q24 only reached IDR 205 billion (-88% YoY, -68% QoQ).

tickerNews.title: CNGR Indonesia Plans to Build a USD 10 Billion Battery Precursor Production Facility in Indonesia
tickerNews.content: CNGR Indonesia Director, Magdalena Veronika, stated that the parent company, CNGR Advanced Material Co., plans to build a battery precursor production facility worth 10 billion US dollars in Indonesia. The investment from the Chinese battery material producer will take place in 3 stages over 10-15 years. Veronika said that CNGR is currently looking for a suitable location to build the plant, with potential partners joining after the plant is built.

tickerNews.title: BNGA 9M24 Net Profit +4.7% YoY Reaching All-Time High, NIM Guidance Downgraded, CoC Guidance Upgraded
tickerNews.content: Bank CIMB Niaga (BNGA) recorded a net profit of IDR 1.7 trillion (+0% QoQ, +3.4% YoY) in 3Q24. This result brought the net profit for 9M24 to IDR 5.1 trillion (+4.7% YoY), exceeding expectations as it was equivalent to 76% of the consensus FY24 estimate. This result marks an all-time high quarterly and 9M net profit for BNGA. BNGA Management downgraded the FY24 Net Interest Margin guidance from 4.2-4.4% to 4.1-4.2%, after the realization during 9M24 was only 4.16% (vs. 9M23: 4.5%). Furthermore, BNGA Management also upgraded the FY24 credit cost (CoC) guidance from 1-1.1% to <1%, after the realization during 9M24 was at 0.88% (vs. 9M23: 1.2%). Credit growth reached +6.4% YoY in 3Q24 (vs. 2Q24: +5.9% YoY).

tickerNews.title: ULTJ Q3 2024 Net Profit Suffers from FX Loss and High Opex Despite Healthy Revenue Growth
tickerNews.content: Ultrajaya Milk Industry & Trading Company (ULTJ) recorded a net profit of IDR 126 billion (-62% YoY, -64% QoQ) in 3Q24, resulting in a net profit for 9M24 of IDR 881 billion (-6% YoY). Revenue growth in 3Q24 was quite healthy (+8% YoY, flat QoQ) and the gross profit margin remained up (+140 bps YoY +50 bps QoQ), but this was offset by a significant increase in opex (+36% YoY, +11% QoQ) due to an increase in advertising and promotion expenses (+87% YoY) and general and administrative expenses (+20% YoY). This caused the operating profit in 3Q24 to fall to IDR 336 billion (-8% YoY, -9% QoQ), resulting in an operating profit for 9M24 of IDR 1.2 trillion (+1% YoY). The decline in operating profit was exacerbated by foreign exchange losses, with foreign exchange and other losses amounting to ~IDR 170 billion in 3Q24. Excluding this foreign exchange loss, ULTJ's core profit in 3Q24 reached IDR 292 billion (+9% YoY, +6% QoQ).

tickerNews.title: WIIM Q3 2024 Net Profit Declines due to Weak Sales and Margin Pressure
tickerNews.content: Wismilak Inti Makmur (WIIM) recorded a net profit of IDR 60 billion (-69% YoY, +6% QoQ) in 3Q24, resulting in a net profit for 9M24 of only IDR 208 billion (-53% YoY). The decline in net profit in 3Q24 was pressed by weak sales (-10% YoY), which was most likely triggered by a decrease in cigarette sales volume. Meanwhile, the gross profit margin also decreased by -700 bps YoY, which was likely caused by ASP increases that could not offset the excise tax increase. Operating expenses rose +27% YoY in 3Q24, with promotion and advertising expenses rising 2.1x, so operating profit in 3Q24 only reached IDR 79 billion (-67% YoY).
